ExternalData.Titlesect: International Convention for the Suppression of the Traffic in Women and Children

TreatyText.Label: Text
TreatyText.Text: League of Nations, Treaty Series, vol. 9, p. 415;

TreatyNote.Text: The Convention for the Suppression of the Traffic in Persons and of the Exploitation of the Prostitution of Others, concluded at Lake Success, New York of 21 March 1950 consolidates the Protocols, Conventions and Agreements listed in the present chapter under Nos. 1 to 10. Furthermore, the Convention of 21 March 1950 supercedes the provisions of the above-referenced instruments in the relations between the Parties thereto and shall terminate such instruments when all the Parties thereto shall have become Parties to the Convention of 21 March 1950, in accordance with its article 28.
